definitions: The office or position of butler to a monarch, nobleman, etc. (now historical and rare). Formerly also: †the department administered by this official (obsolete, rare).

notes.text: In later use chiefly in "chief butlerage", with reference to the butlerage of Ireland, a hereditary office nominally associated with the supply, import, etc., of wines.

definitions: A duty levied, originally by the crown, on the import of wine into England by foreign traders, and payable to the butler. Frequently paired or contrasted with prisage.

notes.text: Butlerage was abolished by an act of 1809, 49 George III. c. 98, §36.
